newsitem.title: CHINA: China bank to form risk control group.
newsitem.headline: China bank to form risk control group.

text.p: The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China will set up a committee to set risk control policies in line with central bank directives, the Financial News said on Friday.
The bank has also decided to boost the authority of its auditing department to implement the committee's decisions, the newspaper said.
The bank needs a more effective risk control system as it moves to transform itself into a bank operating on commercial principles, it quoted bank president Liu Tinghuan as saying.
China's state banks have long been burdened by a high rate of non-performing loans and are now moving to trim the level of bad debt.
The central bank has been trying to ensure that state banks reduce the level of risk when extending new loans.
The Agricultural Bank of China, another major state bank, has already set up such a committee to oversee financial risk.
